Outward Telegram from Gommonwealth R elations Offic e WESTERN & UNITED NATIONS DEPARTMENT » F»3060/1 1 , CYPHER (SIMPLEX) Following is extract from Amman despatch No. 72 dated 4th November. Begins : This person is a Pakistani member of the Ahmedia organisation and appears to have visited the Hashemite Kingdom of the Jordan for the express purpose of proselytising for his sect of Islam. He spent some time in Amman and distributed literature in Arabic fairly widely but, in spite of the fact that the sect is regarded by the Sunni Moslems as being heretical, he failed to attract much attention in the capital. He next transferred his activities to Kerak and there came into collision with the simpler and more narrow minded country folk. So much feeling was generated on the subject that it was considered that, in the interest of his own safety, he had best leave the country immediately and an order was issued for his deportation. He left Jordan territory for Syria. Rashid Ahmed does not appear to have indulged in any political activities during his stay in Jordan. Ends . 2. Above information may at your discretion be used in any way you think best. Copy to :- C.R.O. Mr. D.A. Scott. titleInfo.title: Pol Ext 8084/49 'Deportations - Nominal. Rashid Ahmed Chugtai'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 13; these numbers are written in pencil and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: This file consists of correspondence between the Foreign Office, HM Ambassador, Amman, and the Commonwealth Relations Office regarding the deportation of Rashid Ahmed Chughtai, a representative of an Ahmedia [Ahmadiyya] organization of Pakistan, from Jordan to Syria.
